p: XRD patterns of tea waste char and sulfonated tea waste char catalyst is presented in Figure 3. It was observed that both tea waste char and sulfonated tea waste (STW) catalyst exhibit identical trends of XRD peaks, broad and weak C(002), C(100) and C(101) around 2θ from 25°–28°, and 40°–50°, respectively. Whereas, STW catalyst showed the other peaks at around 12°, 30°, 56°–68° belong to S(001), S(110), S(111) and S(004) respectively [32]. The presence of sulfur was identified also during the Energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDX) analysis (Table 2). The peaks in this region correspond to the amorphous carbon structure which is in accord with the results reported by Yu et al. [33] and Konwar et al. [31].
